title: Far Cry 5
review: Such an amazing game with 1 extremely fatal flaw..every single thing you do progresses you through the story no matter what. You can get through each section just by saving hostages, missing alll side missions. The story is so good but its so darn short because of that. Im playing through my SECOND time. 45 hours, and i milk games bruv

title: Far Cry 5
review: Was a really good game when I COULD PLAY IT!! I bought this game, i have 70 hours in it, I cant play it because "we cant verify that you own this game". bitch i own it and paid for it, let me play it. fuck ubisoft and their stupid 3rd party shit, super unnecessary. And the kicker is that my only option is to contact support and when i click on the support link in the window, it does not work. this game is great don't get me wrong but maby you should only buy it through ubisoft so you don't deal with this issue. fuck you ubisoft greedy cucks.

title: Far Cry 5
review:
Far Cry 5 is the game that finally answers the age-old question: “What if you combined a first-person shooter with a rural American soap opera?” Set in the heart of Montana, it immerses you in a world where you can engage in breathtaking gunfights with cultists, all while secretly wondering if you should have just taken that job in corporate America instead.

The game starts innocently enough: you arrive in Hope County to investigate a doomsday cult led by the charmingly unhinged Joseph Seed. But let’s be honest, the real thrill of Far Cry 5 isn’t uncovering a deep and meaningful narrative about the dangers of fanaticism; it’s the sheer joy of watching your character commit insurance fraud by liberating the county from the cult’s iron grip—one explosive barrel at a time.

You’ll quickly find that the cult is armed to the teeth, and you’re armed with… well, let’s just say your options range from a simple shotgun to an absurdly oversized bear that you can unleash on unsuspecting enemies. Nothing says “freedom” quite like sending a grizzly bear into a cultist camp, right? Forget about the Second Amendment; you’ve just turned Far Cry 5 into a wildlife documentary featuring armed conflict.

The game is a masterclass in “how to annoy your friends” as you drag them into your crazy adventures. Nothing bonds you quite like hijacking a plane and then realizing that neither of you has any clue how to fly it. The resulting chaos is guaranteed to send you both tumbling through the air while simultaneously trying to fend off a cultist helicopter that inexplicably knows how to shoot at you—because, you know, realism.

As you roam the stunning landscapes of Montana, you’ll encounter a cast of characters that are equal parts hilarious and bizarre. From a pot-smoking preacher to a paranoid conspiracy theorist, each NPC is a delightful reminder that reality is often stranger than fiction. You’ll find yourself laughing, cringing, and questioning your life choices all at once as you dive headfirst into the insanity.

And let’s not forget about the side quests. You can go from saving the world from an apocalypse to fishing with a man who might be the next Hemingway. Because who doesn’t want to take a break from combat to catch some virtual fish? It’s like the game was designed by someone who genuinely believes that balance is key—between blowing up cultists and contemplating the nature of existence while reeling in trout.

In the end, Far Cry 5 is less about deep storytelling and more about causing mayhem in the most entertaining ways possible. It’s a playground of chaos wrapped in a satirical package that pokes fun at everything from cult culture to American ideals. So if you’re looking to shoot your way through a beautiful landscape while questioning your life choices and trying not to crash your helicopter, Far Cry 5 is the game for you. 10/10 would unleash a bear on a cult again.

title: Far Cry 5
review:
TL-DR:  If you like GTA5 and don't mind some abused religious references, you will enjoy this game.

Game is reasonably stable, but if you jump to different things, the aging game system starts to show its weaknesses.

Requires a Ubisoft account to access the game properly. I found this to be disappointing. I don't want/need yet another storefront on my computer to try to toss advertisements my way.

The pacing is a bit forced, but there are lots of interesting characters to meet and deal with in this game. There are a lot of religious references here. It is implemented as a way to guide the personas of the BBG and his various henchmen.

The guns are interesting and varied. You will probably pick your favorites and keep them going the whole game, swapping things about as needed.

There aren't levels as much as there are perks and such to help keep things going. None of this is a bad thing. It all works fairly well as you work your way through the game.

Driving is a little off. Vehicles are varied and interesting. The physics can be goofy from time to time, adding to the silly nature of the different aspects of the game. I don't like how the NPC's drive. Certain parts are scripted. Those are mostly OK. The rest of the times, they drive like the way your grade schooller thinks driving should be. Yes, they will jack your car from time to time too. Fun, right?

In each region, as you progress and move through the story, you'll find the difficulty ramping up in each region. It becomes difficult to do much more than sneak around. Towards the end, I find it a bit oppressive. It makes sense though. You are effectively in a war zone.

title: Far Cry 5
review: Listen, I love this game and it is one of my favorite games of all time in terms of gameplay. The graphics are high end, the gameplay is thrilling, the gunplay is awesome and a lot of things are amazing about this game. But the main problem with this game is the pacing and story. I absolutely love fighting the cult and the overall idea of rebelling against a cult following, but the pacing for the game is really bad in my opinion. Every region other than faith's region feels extremely rushed and hard to follow. Characters such as john and jacob dont have nearly as much screentime or character developement as faith and it sets the tone for the rest of the game after you complete faith's region to be extremely repetitive and boring. Another thing ill say is the car and gun customization is not all that great (guns being better) because unless you buy a specialty vehicle, the only thing you can change is the color which makes it feel like its not really "yours" and the color options you do have are extremely boring and bland. No attachments or mods not anything. And even though I really enjoyed this game, I would not 100% recommend this game to most people just because the pacing and gameplay fits a pretty small niche and the story is pretty hard to follow. Still better than FC6 just buy this game on sale if you really want it.  Id say about a 7/10

title: Far Cry 5
review: Far Cry 5 is my favorite farcry as it is base don a non-pussy generation and is the most like real life in the west. I was excited to download this game and play it on PC. That is until a popup for ubersoft came up, requiring me to make an ubersoft account to even install and play the game. This is called bait and switch. I paid my money to own my copy of this game on my computer and they did not disclose ahead of time that you are required to sell your data with another account, made in your name, with another company. Being forced to make a steam account to get PC games now days isn't enough, Now you have to have a steam account and then on top of that make accounts with all the companies producing the games also. These game companies and platforms just keep pushing and violating the rights of customers and they are going to push their selves out of buisiness. IF I BUY SOMETHING WITH MY HARD EARNED MONEY, I BETTER OWN IT AND HAVE ZERO ISSUES WITH PLAYING THE STANDARD GAME I PAID FOR. If it was a free game, then you can pull this shit, but not when a customer pays for the game. It's like going to buy a car, you pay for the car, then when your about to leave the lot, they say you can't leave the lot with your car until you give us any data and information we want for our company and other companies associated with us.

title: Far Cry 5
review: ubisoft bugged and was unable to play the entire game due to refunding it before hand because of an accidental purchase, repurchased and in the shitty ubisoft app said I didn't own it, so I couldn't play it even through steam!

title: Far Cry 5
review:
This Far Cry offers nothing new. The gameplay is stale and repetitive, with the same tired mechanics we've seen in countless previous Far Cry titles. The story is bland and unengaging, and the characters are forgettable. The open world feels lifeless and empty, with little to explore or do.

If you've played any of the previous Far Cry games, you've essentially played them all. There's no reason to waste your time or money on this sequel.

title: Far Cry 5
review: really fun don't need a ultra spec pc to enjoy it! beautiful graphics would recommend

title: Far Cry 5
review:
4/10

 You know the trope: have you played one Ubisoft game, you have played them all. Your first hours are fun and new, even when you’re familiar with the Ubisoft formula. But the more you venture into the world, you’ll realize its just repetitive slog in every game.
And then , there is this game. Oddly enough, I bought 5 and New Dawn on sale, and played New Dawn first, and had more fun with the latter . There are so many things wrong with this title and I din’t even realize it, most of the time, because  of the fast gameplay loop. Pew..pew…boom. Katshing.

The map is huge and nice to look at, with lots of things to do. Bet you read that one in many other reviews, So its good value for your money then, right? Maybe, when you don’t think about it.
Indeed there are lots of mapmakers, a variety of enemies and wildlife, collectables, notes. All the shallow useless activities we know and love in an Ubisoft game.The map is maybe to big for its own good, either way everything feels facile.
Side missions are solely designed to send you somewhere, kill or save someone. Liberate this, collect that. Hunt that animal, catch that fish, They somehow provide less than nothing to the overall story, some are cringeworthy at their best, maybe a little edgy.  [spoiler]For example. In one mission they literally send you out to examine dog shit.) [/spoiler]
Exploration feels as rewarding as the sound , when you reveal a location. Quick and painless. You´ll discover a location, maybe your check for clues or ways to get in. You’ll find weapons, which are worse than your weapon of choice. Loot in crates or rucksacks is abundant, but you can’t collect everything because, you have no room in in your inventory. (Some of a gamers worst feelings is to leave loot behind).
Notes and massages in other games benefit to the world building, here they are just bland, written only to be found. Nearly every note in an abandoned lodge or shelter, tells a story, about…someone, who was here, and is now gone. Or in other notes you’ll discover a cult member upset, that they can’t get in a safe room with good loot, only to find in the next note hints HOW to get in,  And don’t let me start on the collectables. NPCs send you out, in a literal war zone to collect…things. Another mechanic to reveal the map, and waste your time.

Gunplay feels pertinent, but that’s an easy feat nowadays, So every gun type feel the same, only the paint job and the numbers were slightly different.. I saved up some money at the beginning, bought a prestige weapon in every slot and stuck to it to the endgame. Even when you unlock other weapons, they are still uninteresting as boring. Same goes for the vehicles. Bought a boat and  a helicopter, with mounted weapons, a small cart for fast map traversal, and didn’t bother with other options, even when I unlocked more and bigger vehicles. Note here, Ubisoft hits you with a shiny special currency in safes…and provides  a shop to buy more, with real money, to purchase weapons, outfits and vehicles. You definitely won’t need to. To benefit micro transactions they unwillingly broke the progression in that regard.

„New character discovered“! One would think, here is someone important to the story or the gameplay. Besides your followers, most new discovered character provides nothing of value to your immersion, maybe one mission or two, just to sent you out to review more locations.  Main characters have more to say and provide, but are boring either. The gun wielding priest, the sheriff, the redneck, the crazy conspiracy theorist, the woman boss, who doesn’t trust you….  In all that I often felt so lost, at times in the open world, I wouldn’t recognize  what character is talking to me through the radio, Enemy variety is…well, there is a variety. Grunts with beards, melee with no hair but beards, tanks with helmets and beards. Generic classes, which look all the same. And yes, devs even joke about it, that enemy NPCs have lots of weapons but nothing to shave the beards of.
As I heart, in SW:Outlaws you can get mission hints by idle chatter in the open world. Nice idea. Here too, except they have a nice marker above their heads, and the provide useless information and a side quest in your journal. Like I said, nice idea. Until you realize, these are sequenced. One npc in the first region can give you a marker on the other side of the map. Until there is no quests left.  Quickly you’ll forget the little story he gave you with that minor quest. That seems dumb, considering all three factions are isolated in three map sections.  One can only wonder, how to they know about things on the other end of the map? Why don’t they all gather up and fight together against the cult army. Oh right, because you, as the protagonist, with the generic name Rookie, have to do their dirty work.

That brings me to story.The story was ludicrous and in its presentation often insufferably bad. Like the antagonistic cult, Ubisoft wants you to believe, there is a deeper meaning to all of it, like there was in Far Cry 3, Even worse. I felt a strong detachment to the overall story and my own character. Triggered cutscenes offensively undermine  that little agenda I had as a player with my silent character. Every banter with the four main villains is shallow and meaningless, when you can’t answer anything or even to shoot em in the face, like you do  90%  of the game time. Their speeches were insulting and bloated like like they know you inside out. But the only thing they really can judge  the player character is, how I as they lay death and destruction upon all of them. Oh yeah, know this…you are part of the big plan, which is….to fill up the resistance meter in every region, to confront the main villain. So the progress in the story also tied to the resistance in said region. Certain milestones trigger events, like radio massages or abductions. I can live with the mechanic, that my adversaries in a certain region mark me, as worthy foe and send out Elites to kill me. But at every big story milestone, they abduct me, only to provide more bloated speeches and a certain way to go back to the regular gameplay. Until the next part. At times I felt offended  by the ridiculous twists and turns it took, triggered by my own progress, and took completely the control out of my handy..  You can’t tell me ,I am chosen to be a part of your big plan, only to send countless followers with assault rifles or rocket launchers after me. I can walk through fogs of this  Macguffin aka Bliss, only to be knocked out all of a sudden, because its time for another story bit. [spoiler]A hallucination literally forces you to unwillingly kill a main ally, only to be told: nevermind, anyway you are the hero.[/spoiler]. And then these endings. I won’t spoil them, but after reading this, you’ll know my opinion.


Why did you play it then, you ask? Because I have this pitiful urge to play my games till the end… this is type of feeling, Ubisoft is using against their customers. Most of the time I had my fair bit of fun, sneaking up on my enemies. sniping them with my bow or raining down my wrath from my helicopter. Pew,pew…boom!  Katshing. Nonetheless, the turning point was, when I had to catch a fish. Yes. A fish. I tried for five hours on two real days. Even when I knew how the mini game works, I had to look things up, only to read, that the fishing on PC may be bugged, or you’ll have to plug in a controller, then you’ll catch it in 30 seconds. It’s an effing war zone, a world ending plot is going on. People disappear, or die and they send my out to catch a fish. After that I began to write this review, and finished the main story within two hours, didn’t bother finish  some remaining side quests. Overall I am giving this flawed game a cross thumb, because of the fun explosions. But something pulls my thumb down…..

title: Far Cry 5
review: I love the FarCry series and this is my 3rd game in it. I recommend this game to people who love shooters and open world games. And if you want go check out the other games especially farcry 3 and 4.

title: Far Cry 5
review:
★★★★☆

[h2] "You were the start. You'll be the end." [/h2]

Far Cry 5 is absolutely mesmerizing. It's not perfect, but I had a great time with it. If only Ubisoft spent time polishing the bad AI and the bugs instead of adding microtransactions to their games, this game would have been better received. Having a separate launcher to play it is also a bummer.

Hope County's atmosphere and landscape is breathtaking and the combat feels fluid and awesome. The story is gripping and the villains are terrifying and full of personality. Joseph Seed is a memorable and menacing villain, and this is yet another tale that makes you wonder about morality and the consequences of your actions. There are plenty of side missions and typical Far Cry outposts and prisoners to rescue and secret locations so I never felt bored playing. It didn't feel repetitive to me, since I was always progressing through the story and discovering new sights. Being able to recruit upto 2 AI buddies is really fun (all of the specialists are powerful and really helpful). Driving is smooth and there's lot of vehicles and weapons to try. 

Overall, I highly recommend Far Cry 5; I've enjoyed every moment I'd spent with it and loved it's story, action, characters and the beautiful open-world.

title: Far Cry 5
review:
I played 2,3,4 and now this on sale.
Had to say this is only worth it on sale.
Although some shine here and there but overall a major step down from 3 and 4 tbh

.... I bloody faking hate force into anther platform and on top of that the platform doesnt even work properly

1. the story is mediocre at best with boring characters compares to 3 and 4
2. SO MANY BUGS: corpses, vehicles, events, spawn in and out here and there.
3. all the detail just tells the dev isnt put in enough effort/time into this game.
4. The gun upgrade system is SO LAZY
5. The ending is just bad.
6. The stealth mission/outpost is too short and too easy. (I play on hard)

If you are considering, play 3 and 4. This one isnt worth it unless you really want to see the lackluster far cry.

title: Far Cry 5
review: The game is broken. I knew better than to buy ANYTHING from Ubisoft, but I figured it was worth the risk for <$10. I had issues launching it the very first time, but it eventually launched after jumping through Ubisoft's hoops. Day 2, the game is completely broken. I click the PLAY button in Steam, it looks like it's launching, then the button changes back to PLAY and doesn't launch. I opened Ubisoft Connect where it asked me to sign in again even though I told it to keep me signed in yesterday. I also had to complete 2FA again even though I checked the box to trust this device yesterday. I jump through those hoops, Ubisoft Connect is now signed in and running, but the game still won't launch from Steam or directly from Ubisoft Connect. Ubisoft is a cancer on gaming, and I hope they go under. They deserve every struggle they're currently having. They've earned it.

title: Far Cry 5

Games like modern movies use too much dark scenes to hide errors or they have a misplaced theory that darker is better or more arty.

title: Far Cry 5
review:
For this & New Dawn 

Pro: Great graphics.

Cons: Vehicles are devastatingly loud without reduction except master volume.

NPC civilians try to run in front of your vehicle all the time.

Co-op requires port forwarding, which is a problem with side-by-side PCs with xfinity internet, only willing to open gateways for one pc, not the router.

Being through Uplay, LAN is impossible.

After 3 hours of struggle & research, free UrbanVPN fixed co-op connection stability.

Overall, seems like a cake from Hell laced with annoyances.

review: Great story, a lot of challenges, 33h in and yet to be disappointed

title: Far Cry 5
review: 7/10. decent sized map and I enjoyed the plot, which is pretty much the same as the last two Far cry's. graphics looks great and sometimes just had to stop and look at the scenery because it looks so well done. I also liked that the main villains played a larger role in the game instead of just being someone you had to fight to get to and kill in the end of the game. overall enjoyed this Far Cry quite a bit

title: Far Cry 5
review: Unskippable cutscenes, disappointing weaponry, I always dislike respawning random mobs because then you waste so much time fighting them AGAIN when you just want to travel across the map, and then you get kidnapped and thrown into combat that isn't in the location you were aiming for your mission, storyline blunt, gameplay a bit clunky and really not that fun.  Disappointing, expected better

title: Far Cry 5
review: This was the first time I've ever played any Far Cry games.  I do, however, enjoy RPG, open world exploration with missions and achievements so I was willing to give it a try.  I have a bit of a cult fear and am heavily intrigued by them so I decided to try Far Cry 5 first for the storyline.  After 50 something hours, I completed the game and here's my review- storyline is a 4/10.  It felt very hard to follow, even rushed and not fleshed out.  Mega disappointing that it wasn't more interesting.  Open World Exploration - I love the map and while collecting the perk magazines can feel a bit grindy, I did enjoy.  8/10.  Game mechanics- I didn't have a problem with anything except fishing.  Absolutely atrocious.  0/10 for the fishing.  Overall, I give the game a 6/10.  It's worth a play but maybe buy it on sale.

title: Far Cry 5
review:
Gamplay Is Fun. I'm glad they kept the stuff from previous games, but also improved on other things. Story sadly feels like a wasted potential. I think This could've been one of the greatest Far Cry stories if only the writers didn't go so soft with the message and plot. There are some unique things here that i enjoyed though.
This game is mostly mindless fun though. Playing with friends would be the best way to expirence Far Cry 5's goofy and silly side.

Buy This game on sale with your bestie so you can expirience lots of fun messin around in co op.

title: Far Cry 5
review: Good game, cool cult story, fun gameplay-- lots of shenanagins and even 3 endings.

title: Far Cry 5
review: The game is a pretty good shooter, but the terrible UPlay launcher which requires you to sign in to a separate account every time it updates makes me want to not recommend it.

review: Classic fun game to play but do not expect much more. It's quite fun, but also quite standard. Your NPC sniper teamates can do the whole job for you if you place them well, but you would miss hanging out with Peaches. And I want Peaches always beside me.

title: Far Cry 5
review:
Started of nice yet after 12 hours I got bored of the world. 
you can't drive a few second without getting into something, a gunfight, a animal attack
it looks ok, but everything feels so forced.   Flying a plane, helicopter is so underwhelming
no skill, it doesn't feel or emulate in the tiniest bit flying,  
Not comparing it with a flightsim but lets say GTA it just to stiff boring and way to easy.
main gripe is the world itself and the AI.   Assassins Creed,  france, egypt and the one after that 
where more enjoyable with world and AI than this. 

Lucky I picked it up at sale price 
Uninstalled and it ends up as a placeholder in my steam library. 
Game mechanics killed my enjoyment of the game

Before you buy watch some walk through video's of people online..

title: Far Cry 5
review: Honestly wouldnt bother buying unless its on sale. The forced progression of the story was annoying and the characters didnt seem very interesting IMO either. Visually nice and the gunplay was good, but for me thats where the positives end on this game. If i had to sum up this game with one word? Boring. 4/10

title: Far Cry 5
review:
The main things that are wrong with this game have nothing to do with gameplay, graphics or technical issues.  In fact the only thing wrong with this game is that it hits too close to home for its western audience.  It is all fine and good to be shooting some dark skin foreigners it is another to be blowing up uncle redneck red white and blue Amurricans.  If the characters spoke with a say a Russian accent and this game took place in some Eastern European country this would be considered a cult classic.  In fact I daresay its contentious ending would be lauded instead of derided if the setting was anywhere other than America.

Ubisoft made a good looking consumable game, good enough to spend 50 hours running around shooting and doing stuff.  This is a great game to get during the various sales.

title: Far Cry 5
review:
I had an absolute blast playing through this game (multiple times now). I was never big on FPS games (I'm typically very bad at them) so my first time playing may or may not have taken me a couple hours to get through the escape car ride BEFORE tutorial island (I did start playing it on the hardest difficulty available.) But after that nightmare, its just a bunch of silly fun. 
Are there bugs? Yes! Did I laugh at most of the bugs? Yes! Is Sharky Boshaw basically just unfiltered Internet with two legs? Yes! Does Jingleheimer have crazy eyes? OH DEAR LORD YES! Will the game traumatize you and possibly ruin a song for you for forever? Only You can decide that one. ;)

title: Far Cry 5
review: This is the BEST game ever ,, cause it talk about religion things and it came from the Bible like some verses  ,, such a GREAT game

title: Far Cry 5
review: Everything in this game is near perfect. It's like Far Cry 3 but this time you have a lot more variety of content. The villain is great, the atmosphere is superb, and the melee throw are actually one of the most satisfying and fun thing that you can do in this game. One thing that I don't really like is that on the hardest difficulty, you can't go roaming around without getting shot by an airplane. Anyway, very recommended to anyone who likes face paced fps that has a good animal AI and companion AI.

title: Far Cry 5
review: Great fun, open format game - which I really enjoy playing.

title: Far Cry 5
review:
alright story good conclusion (obviously repetitive gameplay)
6/10

title: Far Cry 5
review:
clearly not as good as previous titles exchanging the main character focus for customization seems to have somewhat crippled (imo) their ability to put you in the seat of a character, its possible the writers just need a bit of work on getting custom characters to feel more "alive"/involved, but its not a big issue in my eyes. im not seeing alot of glaring issues really yet, so far ive had a blast watching how the villans act with their crazy eyes during cutscenes. the enemies are a tiny bit repetitive but as long as i get to slaughter mindlessly im satisfied.

not a bad game with the sale price.

title: Far Cry 5
review: this game tugged at my heart strings and made me face some of the trauma i have with christainity, this game makes you uncomfortble with the main villian perfectly. while i feel like faith had redeeming characteristics the rest are an example of pure evil. peaches and cheeseburger are my favorite helpers. sometimes when i get stressed from the main missions i sit and fish and they make me feel better.  the graphics are stunning and i feel like i am really there. 100/10 experience. highly recommend

title: Far Cry 5
review: Dull and bland, just repeat activities. I wish I could just do the storyline without having to do a million uninteresting side activities. All the nice guns are locked behind repeated activities. Skill system is dumbed down and bland. Only good thing is I get to have a cougar and pet it. But otherwise, just boring. Please just let me play the damn game plot.

title: Far Cry 5
review:
The game does a good job of breaking somewhat from the structure of previous entries; there is no tower climbing to bombard you with a plethora of map icons (although there are plenty of open word bloat) and the game is divided between 3 antagonist with one additional one at the end being the main bad guy.  Each of his siblings controls a region of the map and each time you complete missions in the region, you make progress toward a confrontation bar with that particular boss.  Also, you can face the siblings in any order and jump between the regions at will.

Gameplay is similar to previous far cry entries, and I found I spent most of my time focusing on main missions and clearing out outposts.  Although I admit, I always wasted time with the fishing mini game.  For whatever reason, stealth is much harder in this game than the others and I found it was often not worth the hassle when guns a blazing works just as well.  I would have liked a bit more diversity in guns as I pretty much stuck with the same ones throughout the game.

The narrative is where things take a turn for the bad.  I did not find any of the antagonists, and certainly not the main bad guy to be particularly interesting.  The acting and voice work is good all around but ultimately, most of the characters fall flat, are one dimensional, and just mouthpieces for biblical nonsense.  My favorite was Faith but even her character is not well fleshed out.  There are some nice twists sprinkled throughout but I think the story is overall weak.  I also found the various capture missions annoying as they pull you out of whatever you are doing in the world at what can feel like arbitrary points.  

On a technical level, the graphics still look good in 2024.  I wish the developers had implemented something to prevent NPCs from constantly being distracted by the open world.  A near constant issue is talking to an NPC to get a quest but the dialog will get interrupted by some other audio source, random bad guy, or wild life, prompting the NPC to refuse to talk as it thinks its in combat, leaving you to wait around to get the opportunity to resume the quest dialog.  In addition, the game really would have benefited from a third person mode when in a vehicle.

Far Cry 5 in 2024 is still worth your time if you enjoy these types of games.  I have played 3, 4, and primal as well and I would put 5 above primal and somewhere between 3-4 (personally, I liked 4 the best).

title: Far Cry 5
review: By far, my favorite FC in the franchise.  First played it on Xbox, then recently bought it for PC to play it again from the beginning.  The map is expansive and free roam allows you to do pretty much whatever you want; however, once you acquire enough XP in each region, you're forced into a story mode mission that must be completed.  Overall, very happy with the graphics and game play, and I highly recommend it.

title: Far Cry 5
review:
To be honest, I was a little turned off by a few negative comment on the game. But I understand the comments. Ubisoft tries to shove down your throat loot boxes, gambling mechanics and pay to win. (For example you can buy, with real money, silver bar, which you can then use in the game to fast forward)

Also, why do I need a Ubisoft account to play? It's literally a campaign game!

Regardless of all this annoything stuff, it's a fun game. I like it because it's not competitive, and is, IMHO, kinda relaxing.

title: Far Cry 5
review:
A very good game. It has everything you would expect from Far Cry: weapon upgrades, skill and equipment development, hunting, fishing, clearing outposts in various ways, exploration of interesting places, an interesting story and one of the most interesting antagonists in the series. It feels a bit that this game was made for Co-op and there are times when missions are repetitive and boring when you do them alone. Sometimes your character automatically jumps into missions from the main storyline because you've achieved some region liberation level and this can be annoying at times. And of course game installs together with Ubisoft Connect launcher and you have no achievements on Steam.

Buy on sale.

title: Far Cry 5
review: its a solid farcry game. guns are samey, but once you see that the game just gets simpler. play it to the end. highly recomend that. no spoilers.

title: Far Cry 5
review: People saying the game has a thrilling story must also have enjoyed season 8 of GoT. Never have I ever given fewer shits about a storyline or any npcs than in this game. However, the ubisoft gameplay formula with co-op is a lot of fun, and pretty much the saving grace of the game. Just skip the cutscenes, nothing but cringe there. Do NOT buy at full price though.

title: Far Cry 5
review: Really fun game, feels like in you are in an action movie. Found it constant kidnapping a bit annoying but overall a great game!

title: Far Cry 5
review:
Usual grind. Repeat tasks over and over. The scenes with The Bliss and being "hunted" then going through the Bliss levels made me uninstall. Why does every game dev try and make Oscar worthy games with B movie resources? So glad I waited for these b movie grade games to be on crazy cheap sale before giving them my $4.99 instead of $64.99.
If you have no other games to play and this is free or $.99, sure, try it out.

title: Far Cry 5
review: Good game even though i hide the body of the enemy they can still detect it 10/10 would recommened (Can someone please gift some games as long donated thank i'm in debt and i wanna play some games)

title: Far Cry 5
review:
In short, this was a really fun Far Cry game. Joseph Seed and his family were intriguing as antagonist. However, I did feel that Jacob Seed was lacking compared to the others however I did enjoy "those moments" (Don't want to spoil). I will say that this was definitely the shortest Far Cry game I have played to date. I was easily able to complete each area before finishing all the stories. The gameplay loop was really good this time around. Weapon selection was good and the skills were sufficient to say the least. One of my favorite addition was the companions and how each of them play a certain role and you can tailor your companions to your playstyle.

I don't have much complaints except for the ending. Don't care if its a hot take but it was just bad. I feel Ubisoft could have done something differently. Don't want to spoil it here but it really felt unsatisfying. 

Overall, I would recommend picking this up especially if its on sale, which is frequent. Really up to you if you want the gold edition and try all of the mediocre - terrible DLCS. At least they provide you with some fun weapons and vehicles in the base game!

title: Far Cry 5
review:
Apart from the silly storytelling and shit it's a decent game.
But Sniper Elite is MUCH better :D

title: Far Cry 5
review:
Far Cry franchise seems like a "casual" series, but Far Cry 5 delivers some surprisingly disturbing and dark themes. I wasn’t expecting that, and I really appreciate the bold approach it takes.

Game blends those dark themes with absurd quests and ridiculous NPCs, and this juxtaposition works surprisingly well. It keeps the game approachable and light-hearted, yet it doesn’t undermine the overall setting. 

The soundtrack is briliant! It captures the religious themes of the game while maintaining a distinctly American feel. It has a lot of atmospheric and soothing moments, it's very enjoyable and complements the game's vibe perfectly.

As for the setting, it’s also great. Beautiful landscapes and captivating atmosphere make the American backdrop really immersive. Hiking side missions were really fun to experience in such eye-catching environment.

Overall, a solid game with an awesome setting. Don't expect too much and enjoy the scenery, and you'll have a great time.

title: Far Cry 5
review: Game was beautiful from start to finish, was a pain playing it in hard mode but I got through it. I loved this game but getting my friends to play it for the price, nah never happened. I did however play with a few randos we had a decent time. Unfortunately this is were the fun ends Far Cry 6 is beyond buggy I haven't even made it into the city yet I hardly touch it cause it crashed twice and glitch out 4 times and once on the very first mission leaving me stuck for an hr thinking I was doing something wrong. This Far Cry is so nicely polished I can still play a little after completion just to relax and take in the environment, maybe do a few unfinished side quest. Great game would look nice in your collection I highly recommend for solo players, especially if you're just getting into PC gaming.

title: Far Cry 5
review:
The game is... specific. The game tries to tell a story about insanity and how people collapse. To a certain extend, it does it well, but then in other cases it fails. Some points are reiterated too often. And some aren't really developed. The main story is somewhat serious, but most of the side missions are goofy and go into really strange topic (collecting roadkills or launching a teleporter). The writing is all over the place, but if you are willing to put that aside, the main story is ok.

About the running and shooting. It's ok, but guns feel strange in some cases. Some enemies are just bullet sponges and you need to drop a whole mag on them or have an LMG as one of your weapons. Shooting feels very arcadey and wouldn't advice this game for anyone yearning for a more milsim shooter.

The world is quite cool, but it's also too crowded. Pretty much every 100m there are cultists (main enemy) fighting with someone. Yet the whole map seems like low population area (where all these people are coming from?). This is just an annoyance. There are a couple of good locations, but most of them are forgettable.

The missions are very templatey. Got to point. Kill a bad guy. Catch someone. Etc. However, there are some interesting ideas (like missions where your are collecting bulls testicles for a city fair, or one that will condition you do to something horrible), but they are infrequent.

Overall, I would say it's worth to buy when on heavy sell. It's an interesting game, but definitely it's not worth 60 euros.

title: Far Cry 5
review: If you are a fan of yet another generic open-world ubisoft game where you capture outposts and unlock areas, this is the perfect game for you, if you are an otherwise a normal person stay away from this generic cashgrab, graphics are clearly improved from far cry 4, but that's about it - the graphics. Nothing else has changed at all and it feels like a reskin, the npcs are absolutely horrendous and buggy, the story missions are bland, atleast the villain is half-alright. The shooting is boring, no recoil, no feel and it doesn't encourage you to buy new guns since the starter one can carry you till the end of the game. Typical ubisoft generic release.

title: Far Cry 5
review: Honestly the charm of far cry is lost for me. I completed fc3 2 times but this one... Most of the content is boring checklist gaming. Gameplay loop is basically complete some copypaste markers on the map for the bar to fill and here you go your reward is story mission with a cutscene. As a CO OP game i guess its alright but overall pretty blend

title: Far Cry 5
review: an aboslute mess, fights are over in a minute, visually appeasing but its just a fury of bullets and chaos

title: Far Cry 5
review:
Only (the gunfights) are fun, yet disappointing, with lots of mods installed. without mods- If I could describle this game in one word it would be pathetic.
Empty world, hardly any variety. Even the purportedly climactic parts of this game are laughable. Gunfights are braindead if you try whatsoever. Yet 1/100 enemies will be a gunner who needs 5 clips to kill for some reason. One of like the 3 enemy types in this game. Loot is always the same. I think an enemy has thrown a grenade at me twice ever. Enemies are braindead. You can win a 20 v 1 with even a single tree as cover. I had to fire my GFH so i could even have fun shooting the minimal enemies (Which is the only fun you'll be having in this game.)
Enemy movements and reinforcements are predictable, slow, unnatural loud. Most outposts are disappointing. Missions feel like mmo missions not a AAA game with cool stuff and excitement. Random encounters are anticlimactic. No hunting practically. Most NPCs are annoying with cringe forced humor. Guns for hire say a cringe one liner every 20 seconds eliminating any atmosphere. Speakers with the bosses droning on with creepy cringe speeches that you cant turn off. Annoying music blasting in many areas. Enemy encounters feel dumbed down from previous titles. 
Lack of weapon variety. All enemies drive the same cars in the same fashion. Climbing towers is not fun. Missions don't feel exciting or natural like previous games. People you need to speak to are constantly interrupted. Frustrating forced encounters with un-skipable cutscenes. No NPC variety. If you are religious just put down your headset and get a drink when cutscenes start because it will make your skin crawl.
The game tries to be sarcastically humerous, yet also tries heavy handedly to tug at your heartstrings, and tries to get you to fear enemies and hear these ridiculous tales of cruelty and violence, yet when you meet the enemy, it's just another of the same enemy you've been fighting the whole game. I think they stopped planning this game past the opening sequence because that is the only fun part of this game! It sucks because that sequence sets the stage for this awesome interesting and great looking world with sick animations. And then when you really play, it nothing like that! I can keep writing but i'm going to force myself to stop here before i pop an artery

title: Far Cry 5
review:
Played about halfway through on PS4 on launch, had to stop playing due to a bug where the main story wouldn't progress. Quest objective wouldn't trigger. Tried playing again on PC in 2024 and still just as buggy. De-synced audio in opening cutscene, had to play the first gameplay section 3 times due to vehicle randomly getting stuck and exploding. Played for awhile and during one of the daredevil stunt race missions, the vehicle kept spinning during the countdown and then starting me facing the wrong way. Got fed up and stopped playing.

Knowing how the game ends, I have no motivation to play the story out anyway. This game is a mediocre, buggy disappointment.

title: Far Cry 5
review:
First off is this 1990? There is no save anywhere feature.  Stupid ancient console checkpoint system. Absoulte 
f'ing garbage.  Thank god I bought this on sale, now I'm going to have to force myself to play this mess.  You would think by now I'd have learned my lesson, stop buying trash games and give the money to orphans or some other needy charity!

Waste of money. Story is horrible. Can we please bring back the programmers that was writing the story? How about bringing back the office staff that was playing characters? And for gods sake SAVE ANYWHERE!!!

Edit: Buy this if you like: for every 1 mission that is fun, there is 10 that just SUCK!!!! Insane difficulty, time limits and  just SH*tty design. And still stuck in the stone age with NO SAVE ANYWHERE!  Might as well chisel this game  out  on a f'ing rock.

title: Far Cry 5
review: Never allow your computer to force close or you'll lose all saves you have. This game is ruthless (or maybe it's a Ubisoft thing).

title: Far Cry 5
review: At the right price, this is a great game.  Far more to do than i've done, i missed a lot of the side quests.

title: Far Cry 5
review: i just finished the main story, with almost all the outpost and many side quest. it was a great far cry game. the gun for hire system was really good. can't wait to play far cry 6. i rate it 9/10

title: Far Cry 5
review:
Great story and characters! Gunplay is familiar from the rest of the Farcrys. Being able to pilot planes and helicopters is cool. Stealth is a lot different now that you can chuck baseball bats at people. The outposts seem a lot easier than in the previous Farcrys. There's no more grinding for pouches, slings, or medkits like in previous Farcrys since this one has slings and inventory upgrades as perks. Could use more ziplines and handgliders. You can pet dogs in this one.

In short: It's better than 4, still can't touch 3.

8.5/10

title: Far Cry 5
review: I genuinely enjoyed playing this game, but Ubisoft Connect and their requirements to be online all the time is garbage. I'd refund it if Steam would allow it, but best I can do is just not shovel any more money towards anything Ubisoft. Run away if you want to even pretend you own your games.

title: Far Cry 5
review: A game where you drive around a relaxing, scenic, forested landscape. Occasionally committing enough vehicular manslaughter to catch the ire of one of the local politician. A politician whom then drugs you in order to give you multiple lectures on religion and philosophy until you're forced to kill them. Also there's a diabetic bear named cheeseburger.

title: Far Cry 5
review: I've played this game for a week now and each time I go to launch the game I have to try 5-10 times to launch the game before it would let me in. Each time I try launching the game I'll get an error message that says they can't verify my purchase. WTH? You at Steam sold me the game, I'm launching through Steam, Steam knows I own the game because it tracks how many hours I've played and the trading cards I've collected. Steam knows all of the DLC I've purchased for the game, but every time I launch the game, I have to try 5 or more times. Ultimately, I'm still able to play my game, but the launching process's annoyance is enough to rate this down. Lastly, I reached out to Steam to ask for a refund or resolve this so I could repurchase the game but got an email saying the request was denied.

title: Far Cry 5
review: bullshit POS game wont let me even run it without your bullshit ubisoft connect. waste of money

title: Far Cry 5
review: It woould be the best ever if i didnt have to log into a useless ubsoft sign in every time i played ...Other than that i think this one is my Fav i have played all the rest too.

title: Far Cry 5
review:
Definitely my favorite Far Cry, I've played it through three or for times now. It's nice to have a game like this set in the U.S., though I can assure you people that don't live here that our animals don't attack us in real life as frequently as they do in this game, nor do we actually own so many machineguns. Also, even in the most remote parts of the U.S., I doubt a cult could cut off the outside world as depicted in this game. 

The best part of this as compared to other Far Cry games is the guns for hire, you can have two, humans or animals and combine them however you wish. There are plenty of interesting humans to choose from and they all have their own unique voice lines. 

Basically, they could just keep adding missions to this forever to have more to do, and I would never need to play any other Far Cry again. Wish they would. I'd gladly buy extra missions for this game to keep playing in the Hope County setting but get to do something new in it.

Also, the music is fantastic. Check out all the different versions they did of the original music for this game on YouTube sometime, there are some super-catchy tunes in here. They definitely took the music for this game seriously and make it top-tier. The pause menu  music is so relaxing and chill that sometimes I pause just to listen for a few minutes.

title: Far Cry 5
review: Honestly I don't quite understand why this game is so loved. I mean the story might be nice and the mechanics are fairly interesting, but the gameplay style? Playing this game gives the impression that the story doesnt really exist, and you're just doing some side quests

title: Far Cry 5
review:
After 2 playthroughs I gotta tell you, Far Cry 5 is one of the best Far Cry games, if not the single best of them. I sometimes say that a game has been "polished to excellence" and I don't say that frequently, but FC5 earns that title with its fantastic story, pleasant gameplay, and attention to details.

Pros:
- Great graphics, like Far Cry games have always had.
- Amusing gameplay. Mostly what you always expect from FC games, but a little better than previous titles with all the tools that it puts in your hands.
- Fantastic music and sounds! This is one of the fields that the game really shines in, with all the beautiful menu music, songs and, really, works of art. I mean, was it even necessary to make all those damn fine pieces of cult music? Don't blame me if the "only you" track by The Platters gives you creeps from now on though. :D
- Story. As you know, FC games have frequently been criticized for their story. I think FC5 has one of the best stories in FC series. It shows the subject of religion and cults and psychological manipulation well, and at the end leaves the decision if the father was right or not in your hands.

Cons:
- Stealth kind of becomes useless in harder difficulties cause enemies detect you so easily.
- John's character is a bit weaker than the other lieutenants. Faith and Joseph himself are good, Jacob is freaking awesome, but John is not that good. He's a sadist, so what?  He needed more work.
- That Eli moment is so horrible and sad, and there's no way around doing it. I know it ultimately makes the game more memorable, but what the hell! 🤯
Not even sure if it's a pro or a con...

All in all, a great game. I loved playing it and totally recommend it. :)

title: Far Cry 5
review: Its a pretty fun far cry game to play both alone and with a friend, it becomes a little annoying how often you get kidnapped for a cutscene in that game but other than that its a good time

title: Far Cry 5
review: Ubisoft sucks, they won't let me play the game that i already own in my steam library. Like seriously, how sad of a company do you have to be? They ask me for a product key as if the game isn't literally in my steam library and installed through steam, which is clearly not a pirate site. Small indie company btw guys. Couldn't possibly allow someone to play a game they have already bought. Absolutely ridiculous and an absolutely trash company. Don't waste your time

title: Far Cry 5
review:
If you love being repeatedly interrupted from whatever you're doing by unskippable and intensely boring cutscenes then this is the game for you. 

The first hour has zero gameplay aside from a painful slow-walking segment followed by a chase sequence. Also, the game initially opens with a 10 minute cutscene that is REPEATED if you manage to die afterwards. If you're like me and enjoy testing the bounds of what you can and cannot do in a new game, then you'll be watching the intro twice. 

0/10 I would rather watch paint dry than play more of this game. Do yourself a favor and play something else that actually respects the player's intelligence and time.

title: Far Cry 5
review:
Had alot of potentials but
-Weird hitbox
-Bad gun sounds
-Meangingless intervals make the gameplay loose

Could have been a good game but mediocre in my opinon.

title: Far Cry 5
review: several hours. NOTHING MEMORABLE AT ALL. game with 0 replay ability. Thoroughly EH in all other areas

title: Far Cry 5
review: Another rubbish game from ubisoft, last checkpoint system was so ridicilous because u will restart from random point instead of last progress and point

title: Far Cry 5
review: even if the game gets tough dont give up on it and please play through the whole thing untill the end, this gave me one of the most satisfying endings ever. BETTER THAN FAR CRY 6

title: Far Cry 5
review:
IMO this is the BEST far cry experience to exist.
UNLIKE Far Cry 3, the most interesting antagonist is NOT killed 1/3 through the game.
UNLIKE Far Cry 4, the villain is both right and wrong, Pagan Min was just edgy good guy turned bad guy.
UNLIKE Far Cry 6, the world is perfectly sized and filled with just enough unique content to keep you motivated.
5 introduces a villain who'm many can either relate to or who some think is right even if he is doing things the wrong way.
Joseph Seed is an unapologetically evil man that thinks he is doing god's will, saving as many people from a coming apocalypse whether they want to or not.
John Seed is an angry survivor, he was abused both mentally and s*xually when he was a child and it warped his perspective of his brother into his savior leading him to emulate his brother in every action.
Jacob Seed is a survivor of war, PTSD ridden and looking for answers a world has cruelly denied him, leading him to not care whether or not Joseph is right or not, just happy to be of use as he see's himself more as a tool then as a Man.
Faith Seed, the most tragic of all. Her best friend Tracey had to watch as she destroyed herself with Heroin abuse then proceeds to fall in love with the cruel leader of a cult Joseph himself, as he helped her ditch her addictions he filled her head with lies and falsehoods a manipulator would use on a weakened victim.
You are the Sheriff Whitehorse's Deputy, and a silent protagonist, a strong choice coming off of the heels of Jason Brody. This allows you to truly form your own ideas and opinions about these characters without forcing a protagonists views.
This game asks you to think, or not if you just like good shooting.
You are left with a story that was both impactful and well thought out, of all of the Far Cry Games this one is my personal fav.
9/10 for me

title: Far Cry 5
review: It's just a fun game.  It being set in the Midwest USA makes it seem more immersive.

title: Far Cry 5
review: best game every if you like shooting games this is the one for you best far cry game out of all of them

title: Far Cry 5
review:
The co-op for this game is terrible.
There is a really annoying limitation that restricts you to being very close to the other player.
Flanking is impossible and you can not be on different sides of an enemy base without hitting the limit.

title: Far Cry 5
review: Game is Aamazing so far i'd say i'm about halfway through the story and there is sooooo much more to do compared to Far cry 4. They added more weapons, a better skill tree imo, Fishing, and much improved vehicles
